results.title: Dexter Gordon: more than you know [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Don McGlynn, Leonard Melone and Chase Productions
results.brief_description: Dexter Gordon: more than you know looks at the career of the charismatic, lyrical alto saxophone player - Dexter Gordon. The film includes interviews with Gordon and performances from various periods in his lifetime. As we follow his career we also travel through jazz history, witnessing rare footage and recordings from other jazz greats, like Coleman Hawkins, Lester Young, the Lionel Hampton Orchestra and Billy Eckstine’s Orchestra, Ben Webster, Charlie Parker, Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen and Bud Powell. Don McGlynn also includes interviews with Bernard Tavernier about Gordon’s involvement in the film “Round midnight”, including footage from Dexter Gordon’s screen test for the part for which he was nominated for an Academy Award. This film not only includes some fantastic music, it also gives a wonderful sense of Gordon’s warmth and humour whilst dealing honestly with his use of drugs and his years of exile in Denmark.

results.title: Three looms waiting (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ronald Smedley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”
Portrait of an English drama teacher, Dorothy Heathcote. Shows her work in Tyneside with a variety of young people from an approved school, a junior school, and a hospital for the mentally handicapped.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Parting shots from animals
results.creator_credit: Christopher Rawlence, Michael Dibb and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”.
Based on essays by John Berger, the film looks at how man’s exploitation of animals has affected himself. From a variety of locations ranging from circuses to slaughterhouses, the evolution of man’s attitude to animals is traced.

results.title: Passing through Sweden
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, John Kemeny, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film critic of one of Sweden’s daily newspapers says of this film by Martin Duckworth, “Never before have I seen a film that so intensely interpreted the experience of Swedish surroundings … an atmosphere film” in which all the expression is in the pictures.

results.title: Six of the best
results.brief_description: This series looks at issues which affect young adults in their daily life. Six teenagers, Brian, Antoni, Carl, Paula, Sally and Theresa deal with such problems as employment, school and relationships. Passing out, Early starters, Pay day, Pairing off, Shooting through, and Knockbacks.

results.title: Passage west. Program 2: The Awakening
results.creator_credit: Philip Donnellan, Bill Brind, British Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Program 2 looks at the fortunes and misfortunes of British immigrants to Prince Edward Island, through a re-enactment of their history, letters, diaries, and interviews with their children and grandchildren.

results.title: Devdas
results.creator_credit: Bimal Roy and Bimal Roy Productions
results.brief_description: The setting is pre-independence Bengal - Devdas and Paro are childhood neighbours who grow up together sharing an innocent and joyful friendship, despite their different social status. Whilst still a young man and quite a prankster, Devdas is sent to Calcutta to study and in order to help him mature. He returns home years later a handsome man and Paro has blossomed into a true beauty. Disregarding their mutual love for one another, Devdas’ parents oppose the match, due to Paro’s lowly status, and her parents arrange for her to marry another. Paro is willing to risk all, including her reputation for their love but Devdas, weak and unable to defy his family, cannot, and is driven to despair and alcoholism. Directed by Bimil Roy, this film is lyrical and understated in its evocation of the lovers’ sorrow. Features numerous songs with original music composed by Sachin Dev Burman and lyrics by Sahir Ludhianvi and incandescent black and white cinematography. Starring: Dilip Kumar, Vijantimala and Suchitra Sen. From the novel by Sarat Chandra Chatterjee.

results.title: Mummy, daddy Lenin and Mao
results.creator_credit: Dick Foster, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Urie Bronfenbrenner considers the changes that are taking place in the traditional roles of men and women both in the family and in the world at large.
